source.description: Dilute 120µl Round 1 linker oligo (1mM) with 11880µl STE buffer. Mix 90µl diluted Round 1 linker oligo with 10µl Round 1 oligo (100µM) in a 96 well PCR plate.
Dilute 120µl Round 2 linker oligo (1mM) with 9480µl STE buffer. Mix 88µl diluted Round 2 linker oligo with 12µl Round 2 oligo (100µM) in a 96 well PCR plate.
Dilute 144µl Round 3 linker oligo (1mM) with 9360µl STE buffer. Mix 86µl diluted Round 3 linker oligo with 14µl Round 3 oligo (100µM) in a 96 well PCR plate.

Anneal Round 1, Round 2, and Round 3 plates.

AB
195ºC2 min
2slow ramp, -1ºC/cycle, 1 min per cycle
320ºC2 min
44ºCForever
5Total~1 h 26 min

AB
195ºC2 min
2slow ramp, -1ºC/cycle, 1 min per cycle
320ºC2 min
44ºCForever
5Total~1 h 26 min
After annealing, check if there is significant water evaporation for the wells at the corners. If there is, add water to compensate.
Aliquot 10µl of annealed oligo to a new plate. Should be enough for 9×3 plates. Store the plates at -20ºC.

Dilute Phosphorylated_Read2, Read1, Blocked_ME_Comp to 100µM with the IDTE buffer. Prepare transposition adapter and tagmentation adapter mix in PCR tubes.
AB

320ºC2 min
44ºCForever

Aliquot 25µl Glycerol (pre-heated to 65ºC) to a new tube and then equilibrated to RT. 25µl of annealed oligo is mixed with glycerol. The annealed adapters can be immediately used for and stored at -20ºC.

Spin down cells, wash cells with 0.5ml PBS-2RI, count alive cells with Trypan blue, resuspend cells with cold PBS-2RI at concentration of 1 million cells/ml.
AB
1PBS-2RIVolume (µl)
21× PBS2000
37.5% BSA10.7
4Enzymatic RI5
5SUPERase RI2.5

AB
1PBS-2RIVolume (µl)
21× PBS2000
37.5% BSA10.7
4Enzymatic RI5
5SUPERase RI2.5
For each ml of cells in PBS-2RI, add 66.7µl of 1.6% or 3.2% FA (final concentration 0.1-0.2% FA, 0.1% for cell line, 0.2% for tissue) at RT, mix. Keep at RT for 5 min.
For each ml of cells, quench fixation by adding 56.1µl of 2.5M Glycine, 50µl of 1M Tris pH 8.0, 13.3µl of 7.5% BSA, pipette mix. Keep on ice for 5 min.
Spin down, remove supernatant, add 0.5ml PBS-2RI without disturbing the cell pellet.
Spin down, remove supernatant, add 0.5ml PBS-2RI without disturbing the cell pellet.

Resuspend cells to 50µl PBS-2RI.
AB
1NIB-RIVolume (µl)
2NIB8000
3Enzymatic RI20
4SUPERase RI20
57.5% BSA42.7

2NIB8000
3Enzymatic RI20
4SUPERase RI20
57.5% BSA42.7

source.body: If starting with nuclei, replace PBS-2RI in this section with NIB-RI

source.description: Assemble transposome by mixing Tn5, dilution buffer and annealed transposition adapter oligo. Incubate at RT for 30min. The assembled transposome could be stored at -20ºC for up to 2 weeks.
Dilute cells with PBS-RI to 2 million/ml, aliquot 5×N µl of diluted sample to a new tube. For example, for 100k cells, N=100k/10k =10, aliquot 5×10µl=50µl cells to a new tube.
Add 42.5×N of 1𝗑 TB to sample, incubate at RT for 10min.

Add 2.5×N µl of assembled Tn5 to sample, mix well by pipetting.
AB
1TransposomeVolume (µl) 
21× home-made Tn50.625×N
3Dilution Buffer0.625×N
4annealed transposition adapter with glycerol1.25×N
5Total2.5×N

AB

3Dilution Buffer0.625×N
4annealed transposition adapter with glycerol1.25×N

Aliquot sample into 50µl per well in 96 well-plate, seal plate, shake at 500rpm for 30min, 37C
Pool sample, spin down, add 0.5ml NIB-RI, spin down
Resuspend cells in 60µl NIB-RI

Calculate the number of required ATAC reactions. No. samples (N)=no. cells/10,000. For example, for 100k cells, N=100k/10k =10. Prepare 2× TB and 1× TB accordingly. Critical: The 2× TB should be prepared freshly.

source.body: It is normal that the pellet sometimes looks bigger than before.

source.description: Wash with 500µl NIB, spin down, and resuspend with 1152µl NIB-RI.
Thaw oligo plates to RT before hybridization.

Gently resuspend with 1 mL NIB-RI and filter through 40 µm strainer (Flowmi) into a new 1.5 mL tube.
Spin, discard supernatant and resuspend to 50µl in NIB-RI.

Count cells with Trypan blue. Should now be nuclei that will stain with Trypan. Expect ~10-20K if started from 100K cells. Decide number of cells to be sequenced in each sub-library (generally 1-2K for troubleshooting/QC or 10K-20K for a full run).

source.body: optional pause point, may store product at -80ºC for at least a few days. We haven’t extensively tested this. Freezing extra nuclei at this stage at -80°C will usually result in good RNA quality but reduced ATAC yield.

source.description: Assuming N of 25µl sub-libraries are prepared. For each tube add 25µl 2× RCB, 2µl proteinase K (20mg/ml stock), 1µl SUPERase RI, 55ºC, 1h on thermal cycler.

source.body: optional stopping point, may store product at -80ºC for at least a few days. We haven’t extensively tested this. Freezing extra nuclei at this stage at -80°C will usually result in good RNA quality but reduced ATAC yield.

source.description: Mix with 2.5µl of 100mM PMSF (dissolved in IPA) and incubate at RT for 10min. At the same time, prepare following buffers.
Remove supernatant, wash twice with 100×N µl B&W-T without RI.

Remove supernatant, wash once with 100×N µl B&W-T/RI, and resuspend beads in 50×N µl 2× B&W/RI.
AB
11× B&W-T/RIVolume/µl
21× B&W-T400×(N+1)
3SUPERase RI4×(N+1)

AB

AB
12× B&W/RIVolume/µl
22× BW100×(N+1)
3SUPERase RI2×(N+1)
Add 50µl of beads to each sample, rotate at 10rpm, RT, 60min.
Put on a magnetic rack, transfer supernatant containing chromatin fragments to a new tube for library preparation later! The supernatant is stable at RT for a few hours.
Wash cDNA/RNA-bound beads with 100µl 1× B&W-T/RI, RT, three times.

Put the sample on the magnetic rack, wash with 100µl 1× STE/RI, without resuspending beads.

2STE200×(N+1)
3SUPERase RIN+1

source.body: ATAC library and RNA library are usually performed in parallel.

source.description: Clean sample by Qiagen Minelute column with 500µl DNA binding buffer (Zymo) or PB buffer (Qiagen), elute to 11µl EB, elute again with additional 11µl EB (22µl in total).

source.body: Zymo DNA clean up column may result in inconsistent results between samples.

source.body: 10,000× SYBRgreen was diluted by water to 100×, and stored in black tube at -20ºC. 100× SYBR was further diluted by water to 10× freshly.

Clean sample by Zymo DNA clean up kit (225µl binding buffer or 250µl if skipped qPCR), elute to 6µl EB, elute again with additional 6µl EB (~10µl in total). Store the libraries at -20°C until quantification.
Remove all supernatant, resuspend beads in 50µl Template switch mix, be careful to avoid beads to dry.
Rotate samples at RT for 30min at 10rpm.

Incubate at 42ºC for 90min, shaking at 300rpm, resuspend beads every 30min by pipetting mix up and down.

source.body: For cell line, expect 6-7 additional cycles for 2k cells, ~4 additional cycles for 10k cells. More cycles are expected for primary cells or nuclei.

source.description: Purify each sample with 42µl AMpure beads (0.8×) for cell line sample or 31.5µl AMpure beads (0.6×) for primary samples, elute cDNA to 10µl EB. Store the libraries at -20°C.
Quantify cDNA concentration by Qubit using 1µl cDNA. Ideally, dilute 50ng cDNA to 5ng/µl in H2O.

source.body:
Use nanodrop may result in inaccurate quantification
Expect > 50ng cDNA. If cDNA amount is low, it can get away with tagmenting 20ng cDNA; in this case, adjust the volume of H2O and cDNA accordingly.

source.description:

Mix 10µl of 5ng/µl cDNA with 10µl H2O, 25µl TD buffer (Illumina) and 5µl assembled Tn5. Incubate at 55ºC for 5min on a thermal cycler.
Purify tagmented library with QIagen minelute column using 250µl PB buffer, elute twice with 11µl EB each time (22µl in total).

Add 29µl of post-tagmentation PCR mix with 1µl tube specific Ad 1.xx primer, amp 7 cycles.

Purify each sample with 35µl AMpure beads (0.7×), elute library to 10µl EB. Store the libraries at -20°C until quantification.
Recommend quantifying with KAPA qPCR kit and pool to 4nM. Expect > 30nM, average library size ~350bp with minimal adapter dimer.

We typically sequence libraries with a Next-seq High output 150 cycle kit. The sequencing read configuration is 50×99×8×10 for the RNA-seq library; 30×99×8×30 for the pooled ATAC/RNA or ATAC-seq library. In general, ~25k reads per cell per library type for ~50% duplication rate and ~200k reads per cell per library type for ~90% duplication rate
